key_risks: Environmental and regulatory risks due to violations of the Clean Air Act and potential for spills or emissions
Legal and financial risks from antitrust allegations and breach of contract cases
Market and competitive risks in a transitioning energy market
Ethical and social concerns regarding workplace culture and employee retention
controversies: Charged with violating the Clean Air Act at its South Portland petroleum storage facility
Required to divest seven retail fuel outlets by the FTC due to antitrust concerns
environmental_issues: Handling petroleum products leading to risks of spills, emissions, and environmental hazards
Investments in renewable fuels requiring significant capital expenditures
social_issues: Mixed employee reviews on workplace culture, management, and job security
Concerns about work-life balance and management practices affecting employee retention and productivity
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and legal disputes impacting operational flexibility

sources.title: Global Partners - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Global Partners LP (NYSE: GLP) is an American energy supply company ranked 361 in the 2018 Fortune 500. [3] The company is organized as a master limited partnership, and its operations focus on the importing of petroleum products and marketing them in North America. It wholesales products like crude oil, diesel oil, gasoline, heating oil and kerosene.
